Package org.jtrim2.taskgraph.basic

Class RestrictableNode

java.lang.Object
org.jtrim2.taskgraph.basic.RestrictableNode
public final class RestrictableNode extends Object
Defines a node which a TaskExecutionRestrictionStrategy can restrict from being executed. Once, the TaskExecutionRestrictionStrategy decides that the associated node can be executed it should execute the release action of this node.

The release action should not be called multiple times. Releasing a task node does not imply that task will scheduled right away. Releasing only means, that the TaskExecutionRestrictionStrategy no longer wants to stop it from being executed.

Thread safety

Methods of this class are allowed to be used from multiple threads concurrently.

Synchronization transparency

The release method of this class is not required to be synchronization transparent but other methods are synchronization transparent.
See Also:
  • RestrictableTaskGraphExecutor
  • TaskExecutionRestrictionStrategyFactory

  • Constructor Details

    • RestrictableNode

      public RestrictableNode(TaskNodeKey<?,?> nodeKey, Runnable releaseAction)
      Creates a new RestrictableNode with the given key and action used to release this node.
      Parameters:
      nodeKey - the TaskNodeKey identifying the node which is to be restricted. This argument cannot be null.
      releaseAction - the action to be executed to allow the associated node to be scheduled for execution. This argument cannot be null. It is highly recommended for the task action to be idempotent.

  • Method Details

    • getNodeKey

      public TaskNodeKey<?,?> getNodeKey()
      Returns the TaskNodeKey identifying the node which is to be restricted.
      Returns:
      the TaskNodeKey identifying the node which is to be restricted. This method never returns null.

    • getReleaseAction

      public Runnable getReleaseAction()
      Returns the action to be called once the TaskExecutionRestrictionStrategy decides that the task can be scheduled for execution.

      The release action should not be called multiple times, regardless if it is done directly or by calling the release method.

      Returns:
      the action to be called once the TaskExecutionRestrictionStrategy decides that the task can be scheduled for execution. This method never returns null.

    • release

      public void release()
      Allows the associated task node to be scheduled for execution. This method is simply a convenience for: 
       getReleaseAction().run();

      The release action should not be called multiple times, regardless if it is done directly or by calling the release method.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the string representation of this RestrictableNode in no particular format.

      This method is intended to be used for debugging only.

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the string representation of this object in no particular format. This method never returns null.
